direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods are part of the iterator pattern and interact with the state of the iterator to determine availability of elements.
The remove method interacts with the state of the iterator and the object returned by the next method, indicating a dependency.
Both methods manipulate the internal state of the iterator, with reset setting the iterator back to its initial state similar to how next progresses it.
The nextElement method in other iterator implementations serves a similar purpose to next, returning the next element in the iteration.
The poll method in queue implementations retrieves and removes the head of the queue, similar to how next retrieves the single element in this iterator.
